narrative=Elaine Hall, a member of the local survivalist community, was reported missing after she left her home on Perth Road, Dundee. It was discovered that Elaine often traveled without informing her family, causing them concern when she didn't return for several days. An investigation revealed that she had been seeking short-term work, for which she didn't have legal employment status. During this period, Elaine was staying with her uncle, who was initially unaware of her situation. She was eventually traced to Turnberry Avenue in Dundee by staff, who confirmed she was safe and unharmed.

narrative=Elaine Hall, a 13-year-old girl from Dundee, was last seen leaving the family home at 484 Perth Road without informing anyone of her whereabouts. Elaine had recently become deeply involved with a survivalist community, often sharing her newfound interests with her uncle. This group’s activities typically took place in remote hunting areas. Concern arose when her aunt noticed Elaine’s behavior changing, coinciding with her sudden religious conversion. Family members, including Abigail Bennett and Amelia Hall, grew worried when Elaine failed to return and informed authorities. Two days later, Elaine was safely located by relatives at 22 Marine Parade Walk. She had been participating in an event organized by the community, with no harm intended.
